newsitem.title: USA: Netscape desktop organizer due mid-97 - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Netscape desktop organizer due mid-97 - WSJ.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp is expected to announce that it will launch in the middle of next year software that will organize a computer desktop and make Microsoft Corp software just one of many programs inside, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
The newspaper cited "people familiar with the plans" as saying Netscape would make the announcement of its new "Constellation" software at the Comdex computer trade show on Wednesday.
Microsoft's Windows operating system usually organizes 90 percent of desktops and controls other software.
Netscape and Microsoft are fierce rivals in the computer software business.
